paragraphs.text:
%md
### Antes de comenzar

1. Actualizar repo:
```sh
cd diplodatos_bigdata
git pull
```

1. Lanzar [Zeppelin](http://zeppelin.apache.org/):
```sh
conda activate python-zeppelin
cd spark/zeppelin-0.8.2-bin-all
./bin/zeppelin.sh
```
1. En navegador abrir [http://localhost:8080](http://localhost:8080) o `http://nabucodonosor.ccad.unc.edu.ar:<mi puerto>`
1. Seleccionar `Import note`
1. Elegir json en `diplodatos_bigdata/clases/05_ml/note.json`
2. Seleccionar `Clase 05 - Machine Learning`

msg.data:
Antes de comenzar

./bin/zeppelin.sh

paragraphs.text:
%md
## Areas del Big Data
- Analitics (datos estructurados)
- Streaming (real time)
- **Machine Learning**
- Análisis de Redes (grandes grafos)
- Visualización

# Machine Learning

msg.data: Machine Learning
Programación tradicional:

paragraphs.text:
%md
### Machine Learning = algoritmos que generan algoritmos.

msg.data: Machine Learning = algoritmos que generan algoritmos.

paragraphs.title: Entrenamiento:
paragraphs.text: println(s"""%html """) /* %md #### Entrenamiento: %%% yuml type=class style=plain format=svg [note:Datos;Entrenamiento{bg:cornsilk}]->[Algoritmo;ML{bg:red}] [Algoritmo;ML{bg:red}]->[note:Algoritmo;(modelo){bg:orange}] %%% */

paragraphs.title: Uso:
paragraphs.text: println(s"""%html """) /* %md #### Uso: %%% yuml type=class style=plain format=svg [note:Datos Entrada{bg:cornsilk}]->[Algoritmo;(modelo){bg:orange}] [Algoritmo;(Modelo)]->[note:Datos Salida{bg:cornsilk}] %%% */

paragraphs.title: Todo junto:
paragraphs.text:
println(s"""%html
""") /* %md %%% yuml type=class style=plain dir=lr format=svg [note:Datos Entrada{bg:cornsilk}]->[Algoritmo;(modelo){bg:orange}] [note:Datos;Entrenamiento{bg:cornsilk}]->[Algoritmo;ML] [Algoritmo;ML{bg:red}]->[Algoritmo;(modelo){bg:orange}] [Algoritmo;(Modelo)]->[note:Datos Salida{bg:cornsilk}] %%% */

%md
### En big data se usan algoritmos ML **paralelizables**

(más adelante veremos workarround)

msg.data:
En big data se usan algoritmos ML paralelizables

(más adelante veremos workarround)

paragraphs.text:
%md
# Spark Machine Learning Library (MLlib)

* Algoritmos ML: clasificación, regresión, clustering, filtrado colaborativo (recomendación), etc.
* Manejo de features (featurization): extracción de features, transformación, reducción de dimensionalidad, selección, etc.
* Pipelines: abstracción que representa flujo de trabajo en ML.
* Persistencia: carga y guardado de modelos, algoritmos y pipelines.
* Utilidades: álgebra lineal, estadística, manejo de datos, etc.
* 2 APIs: sobre RDD (spark.mllib) o DataFrame (spark.ml)

### Importante

En 2.0.0+ La API basada en **Dataframe** (spark.ml) es *primary API*:

* No se agregan nuevas características a la API RDD (spark.mllib).
* Solo se le corregirán errores.
* Se irán agregando features de RDD a la API DataFrame.

#### Por lo tanto veremos la API basada en DataFrame

msg.data:
Spark Machine Learning Library (MLlib)

  • Algoritmos ML: clasificación, regresión, clustering, filtrado colaborativo (recomendación), etc.
  • Manejo de features (featurization): extracción de features, transformación, reducción de dimensionalidad, selección, etc.
  • Pipelines: abstracción que representa flujo de trabajo en ML.
  • Persistencia: carga y guardado de modelos, algoritmos y pipelines.
  • Utilidades: álgebra lineal, estadística, manejo de datos, etc.
  • 2 APIs: sobre RDD (spark.mllib) o DataFrame (spark.ml)

Importante

En 2.0.0+ La API basada en Dataframe (spark.ml) es primary API:

  • No se agregan nuevas características a la API RDD (spark.mllib).
  • Solo se le corregirán errores.
  • Se irán agregando features de RDD a la API DataFrame.

Por lo tanto veremos la API basada en DataFrame

paragraphs.text:
%md
### Tipos Básicos

#### Todo es
* Estimator = Algoritmo ML (algoritmo que genera algoritmo)
* Transformer = Modelo (algoritmo)

msg.data:
Tipos Básicos

Todo es

  • Estimator = Algoritmo ML (algoritmo que genera algoritmo)
  • Transformer = Modelo (algoritmo)

paragraphs.title: Entrenamiento:
paragraphs.text:
println(s"""%html
""") /* %md #### Entrenamiento: %%% yuml type=class style=plain format=svg [note:Dataframe;Entrenamiento{bg:cornsilk}]->[Estimator;(algoritmo ML)|fit()] [Estimator;(algoritmo ML)|fit(){bg:red}]->[note:Transformer;(modelo){bg:orange}] %%% [Dataframe Entrenamiento{bg:cornsilk}]->[Estimator (algoritmo ML)|*fit()*{bg:red}] [Estimator (algoritmo ML)|fit(){bg:red}]->[Transformer (modelo){bg:orange}] */

paragraphs.title: Uso:
paragraphs.text:
println(s"""%html
""") /* %md #### Uso: %%% yuml type=class style=plain format=svg [note:Dataframe;Entrada{bg:cornsilk}]->[Transformer;(modelo)|transform(){bg:orange}] [Transformer;(modelo)|transform(){bg:orange}]->[note:Dataframe;Salida{bg:cornsilk}] %%% [Dataframe Entrada{bg:cornsilk}]->[Transformer (modelo)|*transform()*{bg:orange}] [Transformer (modelo)|_transform()_{bg:orange}]->[Dataframe Salida{bg:cornsilk}] */

%md
## Ejemplo

### Predicción de género a partir del peso y la altura.

msg.data:
Ejemplo

Predicción de género a partir del peso y la altura.

paragraphs.title: Lectura datos de entrada
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark

inputFile = "../../diplodatos_bigdata/ds/people_sex_height_age_weight.json"

people = spark.read.json(inputFile) \
    .select("kgs", "mts", "sex") \
    .repartition(sc.defaultParallelism) \
    .cache()
    
print("Cantidad de filas: {}. Cantidad de particiones: {}.".format(people.count(), people.rdd.getNumPartitions()))

z.show(people.sample(False,0.001))

paragraphs.title: División datos para entrenamiento y test
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark

trainDF, testDF = people.randomSplit([0.95, 0.05]) 

print(testDF.count(), trainDF.count())

paragraphs.title: Features
paragraphs.text:
%md
### Features

Los algoritmos ML utilizan datos numeŕicos:

* Como **entrada** toman un vector numérico - **vector de features**
* Como predicción de **salida** producen números - **labels**

Por lo tanto hay que trasnsformar los datos de entrada.

msg.data:
Features

Los algoritmos ML utilizan datos numeŕicos:

  • Como entrada toman un vector numérico - vector de features
  • Como predicción de salida producen números - labels

Por lo tanto hay que trasnsformar los datos de entrada.

paragraphs.title: Transformador de features:
paragraphs.text:
println(s"""%html
""") /* %md ### Transformador de features %%% yuml type=class style=plain format=svg [note:Dataframe;Entrada{bg:cornsilk}]->[Transformer;(featurizer)|transform(){bg:orange}] [Transformer;(featurizer)|transform(){bg:orange}]->[note:Dataframe; vector features{bg:cornsilk}] %%% #### (todo es Transformer o Estimator) [Dataframe Entrada{bg:cornsilk}]->[Transformer (featurizer)|*transform()*{bg:orange}] [Transformer (featurizer)|*transform()*{bg:orange}]->[Dataframe Features{bg:cornsilk}] */

paragraphs.title: Creación de vector de features (entrada)
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark
from pyspark.ml.feature import VectorAssembler

vAssembler = VectorAssembler(
    inputCols=["kgs", "mts"],
    outputCol="features")

trainAssembled = vAssembler.transform(trainDF)

z.show(trainAssembled.sample(False, 0.001))

paragraphs.title: Vector Assembler es un Transformer:
paragraphs.text:
println(s"""%html
""") /* %md #### VectorAssembler es un **Transformer** %%% yuml type=class style=plain format=svg [note:trainDF{bg:cornsilk}]->[vAssembler;(modelo)|transform(){bg:orange}] [vAssembler;(modelo)|transform(){bg:orange}]->[note:trainAssembled{bg:cornsilk}] %%% [trainDF{bg:cornsilk}]->[vAssembler|*transform()*{bg:orange}] [vAssembler|*transform()*{bg:orange}]->[trainAssembled{bg:cornsilk}] */

paragraphs.title: Creación de Labels (predicción)
paragraphs.text: %md (es necesario leer toda la entrada)

msg.data: (es necesario leer toda la entrada)

paragraphs.title: Creación de Labels
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark

from pyspark.ml.feature import StringIndexer

strIndexer = StringIndexer(
  inputCol="sex",
  outputCol="label")

# indexer tiene que leer la entrada
sexIndexer = strIndexer.fit(trainAssembled)

trainFeaturized = sexIndexer.transform(trainAssembled)

z.show(trainFeaturized.sample(False, 0.002))

paragraphs.title: String Indexer es un Estimator:
paragraphs.text:
println(s"""%html
""") /* %md #### StringIndexer es un Estimator %%% yuml type=class style=plain format=svg [note:trainAssembled{bg:cornsilk}]->[strIdexer;(algoritmo)|fit(){bg:red}] [strIdexer;(algoritmo)|fit(){bg:red}]->[note:sexIndexer;(model){bg:orange}] %%% [trainAssembled{bg:cornsilk}]->[strIndexer|*fit()*{bg:red}] [strIndexer|*fit()*{bg:red}]->[sexIndexer{bg:orange}] %%% yuml type=class style=plain format=svg [note:trainAssembled{bg:cornsilk}]->[sexIndexer;(model)|transform(){bg:orange}] [sexIndexer;(model)|transform(){bg:orange}]->[note:trainFeaturized{bg:cornsilk}] %%% [trainAssembled{bg:cornsilk}]->[sexIndexer|*transform()*{bg:orange}] [sexIndexer|*transform()*{bg:orange}]->[trainFeaturized{bg:cornsilk}] */

%md

#### Más información
* [Spark Docs - Extracting, transforming and selecting features](http://spark.apache.org/docs/latest/ml-features.html).

paragraphs.text:
%md
### Visualización

msg.data: Visualización

paragraphs.title: Image plotter en Python
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark def plot_classification(df, surfaceDF=None, prob=False): import matplotlib.pyplot as plt import numpy as np import matplotlib.cm as cm from matplotlib.colors import ListedColormap, LinearSegmentedColormap cmap_light = LinearSegmentedColormap.from_list("light", ['#FF5555', '#5555FF']) cmap_pastel = LinearSegmentedColormap.from_list("pastel", ['#FF8888', '#8888FF']) cmap_bold = ListedColormap(['#FF0000', '#00FF00', '#0000FF']) # helper function to display in Zeppelin def show(p): from io import BytesIO import base64 #img = StringIO() img = BytesIO() p.savefig(img, format='png')#,dpi=600) img.seek(0) print("%html
") #print("%html
") plt.close('all') plt.autoscale(enable=True, axis='x', tight=True) if surfaceDF: if prob: pSTable = surfaceDF.select('kgs','mts','prob').toPandas() Z = pSTable['prob'] else: pSTable = surfaceDF.select('kgs','mts','prediction').toPandas() Z = pSTable['prediction'] xs = pSTable['kgs'] ys = pSTable['mts'] xUs = xs.unique() yUs = ys.unique() xx, yy = np.meshgrid(xUs,yUs) Z = Z.values.reshape(xx.shape).transpose() if prob: plt.pcolormesh(xx, yy, Z, shading='auto', cmap=cmap_light) else: plt.pcolormesh(xx, yy, Z, shading='auto', cmap=cmap_pastel) plt.axis([xs.min(), xs.max(), ys.min(), ys.max()]) pTable = df.select('kgs','mts','label').toPandas().sample(frac=1) xs = pTable['kgs'] ys = pTable['mts'] cs = pTable['label'] plt.scatter(xs, ys, c=cs, cmap=cmap_bold, alpha=0.5, s=16) plt.xlabel('kgs') plt.ylabel('mts') show(plt) plt.close()

paragraphs.title: Plot train data
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark
plot_classification(trainFeaturized)

%md
## Clasificación

### Decision Tree

msg.data:
Clasificación

Decision Tree

paragraphs.title: Entrenamiento
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark
from pyspark.ml.classification import DecisionTreeClassifier

# Se crea el Estimator
dtEstimator = DecisionTreeClassifier(
                featuresCol="features",
                labelCol="label")

#print dtEstimator.explainParams()

dtModel = dtEstimator.fit(trainFeaturized)

println(s"""%html
""") /* %md
%%% yuml type=class style=plain format=svg [note:trainFeaturized{bg:cornsilk}]->[dtEstimator;(algoritmo ML)|fit(){bg:red}] [dtEstimator;(algoritmo ML)|fit(){bg:red}]->[note:dtModel;(model){bg:orange}] %%% [trainFeaturized{bg:cornsilk}]->[dtEstimator|*fit()*{bg:red}] [dtEstimator|*fit()*{bg:red}]->[dtModel{bg:orange}] */

paragraphs.title: Probando el modelo
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark from pyspark.sql import Row kgs = float(z.input("Peso en kilos:","80.0")) mts = float(z.input("Altura en metros:","1.8")) dfOneInput = sc.parallelize([Row(kgs=kgs,mts=mts)]).toDF() dfOneFeaturized = vAssembler.transform(dfOneInput) dfOnePrediction = dtModel.transform(dfOneFeaturized) labels = sexIndexer.labels fullGender = { "F" : "Femenino", "M" : "Masculino"} pred = dfOnePrediction.first().prediction genre = fullGender[labels[int(pred)]] print("%html

Género: {}

".format(genre))

paragraphs.title: Featurize dataset de test
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark

testAssembled = vAssembler.transform(testDF)
testFeaturized = sexIndexer.transform(testAssembled)

z.show(testFeaturized.sample(False, 0.1))

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.title: Calcular grilla de kgs*mts para visualizar fondo
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark

#/* Crea grid peso*altura del fondo
# * para el gráfico anterior
#**********************************/

def createGrid():

    from pyspark.sql.functions import min, max
    
    maxTics = 256

    def fgrid (x, min, max, tics):
        tics2 = tics - 2
        return (float(x-1)*(max-min)+tics2*min)/tics2


    minKgs, maxKgs, minMts, maxMts = people.agg(min("kgs"), max("kgs"), min("mts"), max("mts")).first()

    # 1.- numeracion ticks en x 
    # 2.- numeracion ticks en (x, y)
    # 3.- todos los (kgs, mts) 
    return sc.parallelize(range(maxTics)) \
            .flatMap(lambda x: [ (x, y) for y in range(maxTics)]) \
            .map(lambda x_y: (fgrid(x_y[0], minKgs, maxKgs, maxTics), fgrid(x_y[1], minMts, maxMts, maxTics))) \
            .toDF(["kgs", "mts"])


dfGrid = createGrid()

grid = vAssembler.transform(dfGrid).cache()
z.show(grid.limit(5))

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.title: Predecimos grilla del fondo
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark
# Creo predicciones de la grilla
gridPredictionDT = dtModel.transform(grid)

z.show(gridPredictionDT.sample(False, 0.001))

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.title: Plot Decision Tree Predictions
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark
plot_classification(testFeaturized, surfaceDF=gridPredictionDT)

%md

### Random Forest

msg.data: Random Forest

paragraphs.title: Creación del modelo
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark
from pyspark.ml.classification import RandomForestClassifier

# Se crea el Estimator
rfEstimator = RandomForestClassifier(
                featuresCol="features",
                labelCol="label",
                numTrees=100)

rfModel = rfEstimator.fit(trainFeaturized)

paragraphs.title: Predecimos grilla del fondo
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark

gridPredictionRF = rfModel.transform(grid)

%pyspark

plot_classification(testFeaturized, surfaceDF=gridPredictionRF)

%md

### Logistic Regression

msg.data: Logistic Regression

paragraphs.title: Creación del modelo
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark
from pyspark.ml.classification import LogisticRegression

# Se crea el Estimator
lrEstimator = LogisticRegression(
                maxIter=100,
                labelCol="label",
                regParam=0.01)

lrModel = lrEstimator.fit(trainFeaturized)

paragraphs.title: Probando el modelo
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark from pyspark.sql import Row kgs = float(z.input("Peso en kilos:","80.0")) mts = float(z.input("Altura en metros:","1.8")) dfOneInput = sc.parallelize([Row(kgs=kgs,mts=mts)]).toDF() dfOneFeaturized = vAssembler.transform(dfOneInput) dfOnePrediction = dtModel.transform(dfOneFeaturized) labels = sexIndexer.labels posF = labels.index("F") femProb = dfOnePrediction.first().probability[posF] femProbPerc = int(round(100.0 * femProb)) print("%html

Probabilidad que sea mujer: {}%

".format(femProbPerc))

paragraphs.title: Logistic Regression with Poly expansion
paragraphs.text:
%md

* El algoritmo ML *Logistic Regression* es un algoritmo de clasificación logísitica **lineal**. 
* Esta limitación puede salvarse aumentando la dimensión del espacio:

    ![](https://git.cs.famaf.unc.edu.ar/dbarsotti/diplodatos_bigdata/raw/master/clases/05_ml/dimension_expansion.png)

### Para lograrlo puede utilizarse [Spark Polinomial Expansion](http://spark.apache.org/docs/latest/ml-features.html#polynomialexpansion).

msg.data:
• El algoritmo ML Logistic Regression es un algoritmo de clasificación logísitica lineal.
  • Esta limitación puede salvarse aumentando la dimensión del espacio:

Para lograrlo puede utilizarse Spark Polinomial Expansion.

paragraphs.title: Ejercicio
paragraphs.text:
%md

Modificar el siguiente programa para utilizar [Spark Polinomial Expansion](http://spark.apache.org/docs/latest/ml-features.html#polynomialexpansion) hasta grado 3.

msg.data: Modificar el siguiente programa para utilizar Spark Polinomial Expansion hasta grado 3.

paragraphs.title: Logistic Regression con Poly expansion
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark

from pyspark.ml.feature import PolynomialExpansion

polyExpansion = PolynomialExpansion( 
    inputCol="features",
    outputCol="features_expansion",
    degree=...) # llenar (ver documentacion)

trainFeaturizedPoly = polyExpansion.transform(trainFeaturized)

lrEstimatorPoly = LogisticRegression(
    featuresCol=..., # llenar
    maxIter=100,
    regParam=0.01)

lrModelPoly = lrEstimatorPoly.fit(...) # llenar

gridPoly = polyExpansion.transform(grid)

gridPredictionLRPoly = lrModelPoly.transform(gridPoly) \
                            .select("*", ith("probability",lit(1-posF)).alias("prob"))
                            
z.show(gridPredictionLRPoly.sample(False,0.001))

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.text:
%pyspark

plot_classification(testFeaturized, surfaceTable=gridPredictionLRPoly, prob=True)

%md
## Clustering

msg.data: Clustering

paragraphs.title: Creación de datos 3D al azar
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark

from pyspark.mllib.random import RandomRDDs
from pyspark.ml.linalg import DenseVector

dimension = 3
cantVect = 50
disper = 5.0

# Creo cantVect puntos con distribucion normal centrado en 5 ptos distintos

dataset1 = RandomRDDs.normalVectorRDD(sc, cantVect, dimension) \
    .map(lambda v: DenseVector(v)) \
    .map(lambda dv: (dv,)) \
    .toDF(["features"])

dataset2 = RandomRDDs.normalVectorRDD(sc, cantVect, dimension) \
    .map(lambda v: DenseVector([v[0]+disper,v[1],v[2]])) \
    .map(lambda dv: (dv,)) \
    .toDF(["features"])

dataset3 = RandomRDDs.normalVectorRDD(sc, cantVect, dimension) \
    .map(lambda v: DenseVector([v[0],v[1]+disper,v[2]])) \
    .map(lambda dv: (dv,)) \
    .toDF(["features"])

dataset4 = RandomRDDs.normalVectorRDD(sc, cantVect, dimension) \
    .map(lambda v: DenseVector([v[0],v[1],v[2]+disper])) \
    .map(lambda dv: (dv,)) \
    .toDF(["features"])

dataset5 = RandomRDDs.normalVectorRDD(sc, cantVect, dimension) \
    .map(lambda v: DenseVector([v[0]+disper,v[1]+disper,v[2]+disper])) \
    .map(lambda dv: (dv,)) \
    .toDF(["features"])

dataset = dataset1.union(dataset2).union(dataset3).union(dataset4).union(dataset5)

paragraphs.title: Dataset con puntos 3D
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark

z.show(dataset.sample(False, 0.1))

paragraphs.title: Python plotter
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark def plot_clustering(df, centersDF=None): import plotly as py import plotly.graph_objs as go pltWidth = 800 pltHeight = 600 def plot(plot_dic, width=pltWidth, **kwargs): kwargs['output_type'] = 'div' plot_str = py.offline.plot(plot_dic, **kwargs) print('%%html
%s
' % (width, plot_str)) pEvalData = df.toPandas() if centersDF: pEvalCenters = centersDF.toPandas() eData = go.Scatter3d( x=pEvalData.x, y=pEvalData.y, z=pEvalData.z, showlegend=False, mode='markers', marker=dict( size=1.5, color=pEvalData.prediction, # set color to an array/list of desired values colorscale='Rainbow' # choose a colorscale ), opacity=0.6 ) eCenters = go.Scatter3d( x=pEvalCenters.x, y=pEvalCenters.y, z=pEvalCenters.z, showlegend=False, mode='markers', marker=dict( size=3, line = dict( width = 1, color = 'black' ), symbol='x', color=pEvalCenters.prediction, # set color to an array/list of desired values colorscale='Rainbow' # choose a colorscale ), opacity=1.0 ) data = [eData,eCenters] layout = go.Layout( title="Clusters", width=pltWidth, height=pltHeight ) else: eData = go.Scatter3d( x=pEvalData.x, y=pEvalData.y, z=pEvalData.z, showlegend=False, mode='markers', marker=dict( size=1.5, line = dict( width = 1, color = 'black' ), color='cyan' ), opacity=0.8 ) data = [eData] layout = go.Layout( title="Data", width=pltWidth, height=pltHeight ) plot({ "data": data, "layout": layout })

paragraphs.title: Plot data
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark

from pyspark.sql.types import DoubleType
from pyspark.sql.functions import lit, udf

def ith_(v, i):
    try:
        return float(v[i])
    except ValueError:
        return None

ith = udf(ith_, DoubleType())

dsFeatures = dataset \
    .select(ith("features",lit(0)).alias("x"), 
            ith("features",lit(1)).alias("y"), 
            ith("features",lit(2)).alias("z"))

plot_clustering(dsFeatures)

paragraphs.title: Creación de modelo k-means
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark

from pyspark.ml.clustering import KMeans

kmeans = KMeans(k = 5, # set number of clusters
                featuresCol="features",
                predictionCol="prediction")

model = kmeans.fit(dataset)

paragraphs.title: Evaluación de datos de entrada con el modelo
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark

evalData = model.transform(dataset) \
    .select("*",
            ith("features",lit(0)).alias("x"), 
            ith("features",lit(1)).alias("y"), 
            ith("features",lit(2)).alias("z"))


z.show(evalData.sample(False, 0.1))

paragraphs.title: Evalúo centroides
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark

centers = sc.parallelize(model.clusterCenters()).map(lambda v: (DenseVector(v),)).toDF(["features"])
evalCenters = model.transform(centers) \
    .select("*",
            ith("features",lit(0)).alias("x"), 
            ith("features",lit(1)).alias("y"), 
            ith("features",lit(2)).alias("z"))

z.show(evalCenters)

paragraphs.title: Clusters resultados
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark

plot_clustering(evalData,centersDF=evalCenters)

%md
#### Ejercicio

Complete el código siguiente para implementar un modelo que clusterice los datos anteriores utilizando Bisecting K-means.

##### Ayuda
* [Bsecting K-means](http://spark.apache.org/docs/2.2.1/ml-clustering.html#bisecting-k-means) en Spark.

msg.data:
Ejercicio

Complete el código siguiente para implementar un modelo que clusterice los datos anteriores utilizando Bisecting K-means.

Ayuda
  • Bsecting K-means en Spark.

paragraphs.text:
%pyspark

from pyspark.ml.clustering import ...KMeans
from pyspark.sql.types import DoubleType
from pyspark.sql.functions import lit, udf

bkMeans = ...KMeans(k = ..., # set number of clusters
                featuresCol="features",
                predictionCol="prediction")

bkmModel = ....fit(dataset)

def ith_(v, i):
    try:
        return float(v[i])
    except ValueError:
        return None

ith = udf(ith_, DoubleType())

bkmEvalData = bkmModel.transform(dataset) \
    .select("*",
            ith("features",lit(0)).alias("x"), 
            ith("features",lit(1)).alias("y"), 
            ith("features",lit(2)).alias("z"))

bkmCenters = sc.parallelize(bkmModel....()).map(lambda v: (DenseVector(v),)).toDF(["features"])

bkmEvalCenters = bkmModel.transform(bkmCenters) \
    .select("*",
            ith("features",lit(0)).alias("x"), 
            ith("features",lit(1)).alias("y"), 
            ith("features",lit(2)).alias("z"))

%pyspark

plot_clustering(bkmEvalData,centersDF=bkmEvalCenters)

msg.data:
<script>
    var heads = document.getElementsByTagName('h2');
    var numHeads = heads.length;
    var inner = "";
    var i = 0;
    var j = 0;
    while (i < numHeads){
        inner = heads[i].innerHTML;
        if (inner.search(".-") != -1 ) {
            j++;
            heads[i].innerHTML = inner.replace(/(~|\d+)\.-/,""+j+".-");
        }
        i++
    }
</script>
